Key Match Events: Anthony Davis led the Lakers to a 123-116 comeback win with a 35-point night.
Austin Reaves served as the Lakers' primary ball handler in the middle of the second period, creating opportunities for Davis.
Reaves and Anthony Davis continued their two-man combo, with Reaves finding Davis inside the paint multiple times.
The Lakers achieved their first 2-0 start to their season since the 2010-11 season.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Davis carried the Lakers for the second straight game, putting up 35 points, eight rebounds, four assists, two blocks and one steal.
Austin Reaves had a huge 26-point game and should be applauded for feeding Davis the entire night.
LeBron James facilitated a lot on Friday after dishing out eight assists matched with 21 points.
Rui Hachimura contributed with 14 points and seven rebounds.
The Lakers' victory over two of the best teams in the Western Conference might be the confidence booster they need to consistently win this season.
